name: Idiopathic Retroperitoneal Fibrosis with Ureteral Obstruction
chief_complaint: I have severe back pain and haven't been able to urinate properly for days
prognosis: Variable; depends on early intervention. Renal function may recover with treatment but chronic kidney disease can develop in delayed cases
description: A rare inflammatory condition where fibrotic tissue develops in the retroperitoneal space, often encasing and compressing the ureters. The idiopathic form has no known cause, though some cases may be associated with IgG4-related disease. Progressive fibrosis leads to hydronephrosis and renal impairment.
risk_factors: exposure to certain medications (ergot derivatives, beta-blockers)
multiple_choice: Idiopathic Retroperitoneal Fibrosis with Ureteral Obstruction
